newsitem.title: USA: US rig count down eight to 881 in week.
newsitem.headline: US rig count down eight to 881 in week.

text.p: The number of rigs exploring for oil and natural gas in the United States stood at 881 as of May 2, down eight from the prior week and 132 above the year-ago total of 749, Baker Hughes Inc reported.
The number of rigs drilling on land fell by four to 732, while rigs working offshore dropped by three to 123.

The number of rigs active in inland waters fell by one to 26. Among the individual states, the biggest changes occurred in Louisiana, which fell by 14, Texas, which dropped by seven and Oklahoma and Kansas, which both rose by five.
Gulf of Mexico dipped three to 118.
